tn.ref: gives any of his children to Molech
tn.text: Those who worshiped Molech sacrificed their children to him by means of fire. The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "kills any of his children as a sacrifice to Molech" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: must certainly be put to death. The people in the land must stone him with stones
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "the people in the land must stone him to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: I also will set my face against that man
tn.text: The phrase "set my face against" is an idiom which means "to reject" or "to oppose strongly." AT: "I will also reject him" or "I will also oppose him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: he has given his child
tn.text: "he has sacrificed his child"

tn.ref: so as to defile my holy place and profane my holy name
tn.text: "and by doing that, he has defiled my holy place and profaned my holy name"

tn.ref: profane my holy name
tn.text: God's name represents God and his reputation. AT: "dishonor my reputation" or "dishonor me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: close their eyes to
tn.text: The phrase "to close their eyes" implies they "cannot see" and  represents their inability to understand. AT: "disregard" or "ignore" (UDB) (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: who prostitutes himself in order to play the harlot with Molech
tn.text: This phrase compares those who are unfaithful to Yahweh to prostitutes. AT: "who is unfaithful to Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: so as to prostitute themselves with them
tn.text: This phrase compares the unfaithful people to prostitutes. AT: "by doing that, they seek advice from the spirits rather than from me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: set my face against
tn.text: "to reject" or "to oppose strongly" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]]). See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:20:03|20:3]].

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Yahweh continues telling Moses what the people must do.

tn.ref: You must keep my commands and carry them out
tn.text: The words "keep" and "carry out" mean basically the same thing. They are used together in order to emphasize that the people must obey God. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: must surely be put to death
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "you must surely put to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: The man who commits adultery with another man's wife, that is, anyone who commits adultery with his neighbor's wife
tn.text: The full meaning of this can be made explicit. AT: "The man who commits adultery with someone else's wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: certainly be put to death
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "you must certainly put both of them to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: lies down with his father's wife to sleep with her
tn.text: This is a polite way of saying that he had sex with his father's wife. Some languages use more direct phrases such as "has sex with his father's wife." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: They have committed perversion
tn.text: Here God calls a man having sex with his son's wife a "perversion", a serious sin. See how you translated "perversion" in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:18:22|18:23]].

tn.ref: a man sleeps with
tn.text: This is a polite way of saying that he had sex with another man. Some languages use more direct phrases such as "a man had sex with." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: as with a woman
tn.text: The way he treats the man is the same way he would treat a woman. AT: "just like he would with a woman" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])

tn.ref: something detestable
tn.text: "something shameful" or "something repulsive"

tn.ref: They must surely be put to death
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "You must surely put them to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: They must be burned, both he and the women
tn.text: This can be translated in active form. AT: "You must burn to death both the man and the women" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: he must surely be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "you must surely put him to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: you must kill the woman and the animal. They must certainly be put to death
tn.text: Both clauses mean the same thing. They emphasize that the woman and animal must die. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: They must certainly be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "You must certainly put them to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: a man sleeps with
tn.text: This is a polite way of saying that he had sex with his sister. Some languages use more direct phrases such as "a man had sex with." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: either his father's daughter or his mother's daughter
tn.text: This means a man cannot sleep with his sister, even if she has a different mother or father.  The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "whether it is his full sister or half-sister" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: must be cut off from
tn.text: A person being excluded from his community is spoken of as if he had been cut off from his people, as one would cut a piece of cloth or cut a branch from a tree. This can be translated in active form. See how you translated this idea in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:07:19|7:20]]. AT: "that person may no longer live among his people" or "you must separate that person from his people"

tn.ref: He must carry his guilt
tn.text: This phrase means the man is responsibile for his sin. AT: "He is responsible for his sin" or "You must punish him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: menstrual period
tn.text: the time when a woman bleeds from her womb

tn.ref: he has uncovered the flow of her blood, the source of her blood
tn.text: This phrase compares having sex with a woman during her menstrual period to removing the cover off of something that should remain hidden. The fact that this was a shameful thing to do can be stated clearly. AT: "he has done a shameful thing by by uncovering the flow of her blood"  (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: Both the man and woman must be cut off
tn.text: It can be stated clearly why this must be done. AT: "Because they have done this shameful thing, both the man and woman must be cut off" (See:  [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: sleeps with
tn.text: This is a polite way of saying that he had sex with his aunt. Some languages use more direct phrases such as "had sex with." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])

tn.ref: You must carry your own guilt
tn.text: The idiom "carry your own guilt" means "you are responsible for your own sin." AT: "You are responsible for your sin" or "I will punish you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: I will take away any inheritance their children might receive from their parents
tn.text: Many versions of the Bible translate this as "they will die childless."

tn.ref: the land into which I am bringing you to live will not vomit you up
tn.text: This phrase describes the land as a vomiting person who needs to reject bad food. Instead of rejecting bad food, the land rejects the people and removes them. See how you translated this metaphor in [[:en:bible:notes:lev:18:24|18:25]]. AT: "the land to which I am bringing you will not reject you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_personification]])

tn.ref: You must not walk in
tn.text: Doing the actions of idol worshipers is spoken of as walking in their ways. AT: "you must not follow" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: drive out
tn.text: "remove"

tn.ref: a land flowing with milk and honey
tn.text: The phrase "flowing with milk and honey" means "that is rich and productive with enough food for everyone." AT: "a land that is excellent for cattle and farming" or "a productive land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: I have separated you
tn.text: "I have distinguished you" or "I have set you apart"

tn.ref: talks with
tn.text: "attempts to communicate with"

tn.ref: must certainly be put to death
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "they must certainly put to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
